page.title: 14INTERVIEW- 3 young people
page.content: These teenagers have lived in or near the area all their lives and are at present working here.Comparing their lives with those of urban teen- agers they regretted the reliance they have had to place on their parents for transport.They felt that bus services should be improved though they admitted that now they had their own transport they would not use them even if they were improved. They all agreed that being brought up in a rural area was preferable to urban life.They appreciated the peace and beauty of the countryside and hoped in the future to come back here or to a similiar area to live. Their social life had been based on school rather than their respective villages and their friends were mainly those they had made at school.Private parties and discos formed the greater
